name: Chesterfield FC History Quiz | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year was the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1866.

	The club were formed in this year, but folded in 1881, only to return 3 years later in 1884. In 1888 they were renamed as Chesterfield Town, and in 1919 they changed the club name again to Chesterfield Municipal, but reverted back to the original Chesterfield Football Club a year later.

questions.text: Who was the first manager in the club's history?
questions.explanation:
E Russell Timmeus.

	Timmeus managed the club from 1891-95, followed by Gillies (1895-1901), Hind (1901-02), and Hoskin between 1902-06.

questions.text: In 1909, Chesterfield were involved in a story that was dubbed 'The Parsonage Affair', when they tried to sign George Parsonage from Fulham. What was the outcome of this story?
questions.correct: Parsonage was banned from football for life
options: Fulham sold the player to another team
Chesterfield signed the player, but he never played for them
questions.explanation:
Parsonage was banned from football for life.

	In these years, the Football League has a maximum amount a player could receive as a signing-on fee which was £10. Parsonage asked Chesterfield for a £50 signing-on fee, and was reported to the FA, who in turn, banned him from the game for life. At the end of the season, the club was voted out of the Football League (they finished last in the Second Division three seasons in a row).

questions.text: Which of these scored the most goals in a season for the club?
questions.explanation:
Jimmy Cookson.

	Cookson scored an amazing 44 goals in the 1925-26 Division Three (North) season.

questions.text: From which club did Chesterfield sign the much travelled David Reeves in 2002?
questions.explanation:
Oldham Athletic.

	Reeves began his career at Sheffield Wednesday in 1986, and has played for Scunthorpe United, Heswell, Burnley, Bolton Wanderers, Notts County, Carlisle United and Preston North End, before signing for Chesterfield for the first time, then Oldham for a year, and finally, back to Chesterfield.

questions.text: When the club won the Division Four title in 1984-85 season, how many points did they win?
questions.explanation:
91.

	Chesterfield won 26 out of 46 games, drawing 13, and losing just 7 to become champions of the fourth division.

questions.text: Which of these managed the club in the 1970's?
questions.explanation:
Arthur Cox.

	Cox managed the club between 1976-80, and went on to manage Newcastle United and Derby County.

questions.text: Who did Chesterfield beat in a 1903 Division Two match 10-0, which set the record for their biggest League win in their history?
questions.explanation:
Glossop.

	The game took place on 17th January, 1903.

questions.text: In which season did Chesterfield first win a Divisional title?
questions.explanation:
1930-31.

	The club won the 1930-31 Division Three (North) title with 58 points, just one clear of Lincoln City in second place.

questions.text: Former Chesterfield player Kevin Davies was sold to which club in 1997?
questions.explanation:
Southampton.

	Southampton snapped up Davies after he had impressed in English football, but after just 30 League games, was sold onto Blackburn Rovers, where he flopped, and moved back to Southampton just one year later in 1999.
